comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: The same gents in suits appear in an earlier mystery photo. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6426858843/in/photostream/] As for the aircraft itself (TF-102A / USAF Ser. No. 54-1353), it escaped the scrappers and now sits in a place of honor at Century Circle at Edwards Air Force Base. See: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rightstuffphotography/4583078884/] Photo Credit: rightstuffphotography Flickr Photo Stream

comment.author: 34279950@N02
comment._content: Is it Chuck Yeager the first sound barrier pilot.

comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content: These TF-102A Convair photos seem to go together: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6426858781/in/set-72157628196419561] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6432937255/in/set-72157628196419561/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6432937163/in/set-72157628196419561/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6432954341/in/set-72157628196419561/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6432954289/in/set-72157628196419561/][http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6426858843/in/set-72157628196419561] (I'm not so sure the last one, where they're out of uniform, is the same people. But TVL1970 seems to think so, and s/he could be right, I suppose.)
